ratings.comment: While Professor Rooney may not be the best lecturer, he was a very understanding teacher. I went to his office hours for a completely different math course and he still took time to help me understand. I also had many health issues during the semester and he was INCREDIBLY kind and supportive of my recovery and made generous accommodations.

Turned 75 minute lecture into 50 every time, speeds through everything. Feels like review session for something we already know vs learning it. Doesn't elaborate on anything, have to interrupt mid lecture to ask questions. Class is not hard but get ready to teach yourself if he is your professor. Does all work in his head, makes lots of math errors

The worst professor ive ever had. He does not care about his students and does not make an effort to explain anything ever. The class is decent itself but only if you watch youtube videos and not his lectures.

Where do I even begin? He is a terrible lecturer, changes topics mid-sentence, and talks in a very incoherent way. He Has a lot of verbal quirks that make following him really hard. I constantly found myself being confused in his lectures, even on topics that I knew very well beforehand. The contents of his lecture are poorly organized as well.

Brutal on the grading, stated the curve was anything less than 80 is a D when the class average on the midterm was 78. He intentionally made the exam harder because the class was online and the questions were way too hard for every exam to finish in time. Consistently did not upload lectures and assignments on time. AVOID HIM ONLINE

I originally rated him a 3 star about half way through the course but I was wrong. He truly is a good professor I just wasnt putting the work in. I highly recommend taking him for math 320, he has very fair exams and prepares you well for them. The practice exams are very similar to the real exam and he doesnt throw surprises at you

He is a great guy, but hes not always the best at teaching the material. He lectures extremely fast. It helped a lot to have a good TA to help learn the material, but I still ended up using google and khan academy a lot to learn during this course. The tests are fair and very similar to practice tests. I'd recommend the class for that reason.

Frank is not the best, not the worst. The class was very easy in that the practice exams exactly mirrored the real exams. When some1 in lecture tries to ask a Q, he interrupts a lot, trying to explain himself before letting the person finish. I took the class over the summer so I had daily quizzes, not too difficult. Weekly problem sets. Curved.

Absolutely horrible lecturer who reignited my hatred for math. He would always walk into a few minutes late head straight to the board and talk at the chalkboard for the entire lecture period. He has a very monotonous voice which made it very difficult to stay awake. If you struggle at math I'd suggest another professor or be prepared to work hard.
Go to lectures, pay attention in discussion and you should be fine. Also, Frank is very, very helpful during office hours
great guy, fair exams. enroll for his classes
Easily the worst class structure I've  ever experienced.  Rooney does a good job with what he's given, but the class text book is terrible.
He's a good teacher, wish he would go a little slower

Prof. Rooney is the best professor ever! He is there for you when you need help and will sit down and help you even with what might be the easiest question. If you have the opportunity to have him as a professor, PICK HIM!!!!

Frank is the best Math Professor at UW hands down.  Door is constantly open to help and is very patient and kind.  Makes HW tougher for exposure to complex problems/scenarios while making exams more straightforward. Never tries to trick you.  Get to know him as your prof and then he will let you come by for math help in future courses. Great guy.

I took no notes, barely went to class. What you need to do is go to his office hours!!!! i went with the practice exam (just like the actual one) and asked him to review it with me, i did the same thing with the homework. Do what i just said, if you don't then you're just throwing away an easy A
the midterms are similar to the practice exams he gave, so study them and you will be fine :)

Frank Is fantastic, go see him if you're struggling. He has a way of explaining things one on one that can't be done in lecture. Very very approachable and a great guy. Midterms are just like the practice ones he gives. Go to class and understand the concepts and you'll do great! Best math teacher I've had here at UW
